natal_chart.title: Birth Chart
natal_chart.calculating: Your personal profile is being generated...
natal_chart.planets_description: Each planet represents an archetype, an inner voice within you. The Sun represents your essence, the Moon your emotional nature, Mercury your mind, Venus your love language, Mars your will. The outer planets show generational energies and deep transformation potential.
natal_chart.houses_description: The twelve houses represent twelve sacred areas of life. Each house is like a temple - with its own rituals, lessons, and treasures.
natal_chart.aspects_description: Aspects show how different energies within you relate to each other. Trines indicate natural talents, squares show growth opportunities, oppositions point to polarizations that need balancing.
natal_chart.retrograde_description: Retrograde planets turn that planet's energy inward. During these periods, it's beneficial to direct that energy toward inner motivation.

love_advice.aries: Be patient, don't make sudden decisions. The right person is worth the wait.
love_advice.taurus: Be open to change. Sometimes you need to step out of your comfort zone.
love_advice.gemini: Focus on one relationship. Too many options can be confusing.
love_advice.cancer: Open your shell. Don't push everyone away to protect yourself.
love_advice.leo: Sometimes take a back seat. A relationship is for two people.
love_advice.virgo: Let go of perfectionism. There's no such thing as perfect love.
love_advice.libra: Listen to your own voice. Don't try to please everyone.
love_advice.scorpio: Learn to trust. Not everyone is trying to hurt you.
love_advice.sagittarius: Learn to commit while preserving your freedom.
love_advice.capricorn: Put work aside, make room for emotions.
love_advice.aquarius: Reduce emotional distance. Intimacy is not weakness.
love_advice.pisces: Be realistic. See the real love instead of the one in dreams.
love_advice.default: Open your heart, let love in.

smart_responses.aries_relationship:
‚ôà Thinking about a relationship with an Aries? As a {sign}, here's what you should know:

üî• Aries are fiery, passionate and impatient. They like to make the first move!

üíï Your compatibility: {compatibility}

‚ö†Ô∏è Note: Aries can get bored easily, keep the excitement alive. They love challenges but avoid ego clashes.

üí° Tip: Respect their independence, join the adventure!
smart_responses.scorpio_relationship:
‚ôè Scorpios are the most mysterious and intense lovers of the century!

üîÆ Why mysterious? As Pluto's children, they live in the depths. They don't easily reveal their feelings, but once they commit, they're loyal to death.

{sign}'s compatibility with you: {compatibility}

‚ö†Ô∏è Note: Jealousy and possessiveness can be strong. Build trust, share your secrets.

üíã Bonus: One of the most passionate signs in bed... üî•
smart_responses.leo_attention:
‚ôå Why do Leos always seek attention?

üëë As children of the Sun, they were born "stars"! Attention and appreciation are their oxygen.

üé≠ Reality: They're actually very generous and warm-hearted. They give as much love as they seek attention.

{sign}'s compatibility with you: {compatibility}

üí° Tip: Praise them, appreciate them, share the stage. In return, you'll have the most loyal and protective partner!
smart_responses.gemini_decisions:
‚ôä Why can't Gemini make decisions?

üåÄ As Mercury's children, they think dually - they see both sides of everything!

üí¨ Reality: It's not indecisiveness, it's the need to evaluate all options. They're very smart!

{sign}'s compatibility with you: {compatibility}

‚ö†Ô∏è Note: They can get bored, intellectual stimulation is essential. Conversation, debate, exchange of ideas is key!

üòú Bonus: You'll never be bored with a Gemini - they're like a different person every day!
smart_responses.fire_water_compatibility:
üî•üíß Are Fire and Water signs compatible?

‚ö° Challenging but possible! Fire (Aries, Leo, Sagittarius) brings passion and energy. Water (Cancer, Scorpio, Pisces) adds emotional depth.

‚úÖ Pros:
‚Ä¢ Passion + Emotionality = Intense romance
‚Ä¢ They can balance each other
‚Ä¢ High attraction

‚ùå Cons:
‚Ä¢ Fire too fast, Water too sensitive
‚Ä¢ Communication gaps can occur
‚Ä¢ Fire can evaporate water, Water can extinguish fire

üí° Solution: Patience, understanding and finding middle ground is essential!
smart_responses.most_loyal:
üí´ Most loyal signs ranking:

ü•á 1. SCORPIO - Once committed, loyal to death! But they never forget betrayal.

ü•à 2. TAURUS - Earth element, reliable and loyal. Doesn't like change.

ü•â 3. CANCER - Family-oriented, protective and loyal. Strong emotional bond.

4. CAPRICORN - Responsible and committed. Takes marriage seriously.

5. LEO - Loyal but needs attention. Stays loyal when gets attention.

‚ö†Ô∏è Least loyal: Gemini (changeable), Sagittarius (freedom-loving), Aquarius (independent)
smart_responses.most_jealous:
üòà Most jealous signs:

üî• 1. SCORPIO - King/Queen of jealousy! Intense possessiveness, trust issues.

2. LEO - Ego matter. "What's mine can't be anyone else's" mentality.

3. TAURUS - Strong possessive instinct. Slow to trust but can have jealousy outbursts.

4. CANCER - Emotional jealousy. Withdraws when feeling insecure.

5. ARIES - Can have sudden anger outbursts but passes quickly.

üòé Least jealous: Sagittarius, Aquarius, Gemini - they value freedom!
smart_responses.most_passionate:
üíã Most passionate signs in bed:

üî• 1. SCORPIO - Undisputed champion! Passion, intensity, depth... They turn it into an art form.

2. ARIES - Fiery and energetic. Spontaneous and adventurous.

3. LEO - Dramatic and showy. Performance matters!

4. TAURUS - Master of sensual pleasures. Slow but effective.

5. PISCES - Romantic and dreamy. Emotional connection + physical = perfect!

üòå Least: Virgo (too analytical), Capricorn (work-focused), Aquarius (mind elsewhere)

numerology.title: What do numbers tell you?
numerology.destiny_number_desc: Calculated from your name, this number reflects potential themes and characteristics in your life.
numerology.shadow_side_footer: These aspects can be transformed with awareness. Accepting the shadow is not empowering it - it is integrating it.
numerology.karmic_debt_message: Your chart has {debts} karmic debt. Tap for details.
numerology.ancient_secret_desc: Numerology is an ancient reflection system using mathematical symbolism. From Pythagoras to Kabbalah, many cultural traditions explored the meaning of numbers. Your birth date and name can be used as themes for self-reflection and personal exploration. Each number represents symbolic qualities to consider. This is a tool for introspection, not prediction.
numerology.kadim_content: Since Pythagoras, many traditions have explored symbolic meanings of numbers. Your life path number is a reflection theme - a way to think about personal qualities and life patterns. These symbolic associations can be useful for journaling and self-discovery.
numerology.karmic_13_desc: A karmic debt arising from laziness and irresponsibility. Must be balanced through hard work and discipline in this life.
numerology.karmic_14_desc: A debt from misusing freedom. Learning responsibility and moderation is required in this life.
numerology.karmic_16_desc: A debt from ego and relationship issues. Requires humility and inner transformation.
numerology.karmic_19_desc: A debt from misusing power and authority. Learning the balance of independence and helping others is required.
numerology.karmic_default_desc: This number carries a karmic debt and requires certain lessons to be learned in this life.

reiki.title: Reiki
reiki.subtitle: Universal Life Energy
reiki.description: Reiki means 'universal life energy' in Japanese. This energy flowing through the hands activates the body's natural healing mechanisms and dissolves energy blocks. It provides stress reduction, relaxation, and holistic healing.

kyo_dake_wa.description: Focus on the present moment. The past is gone, the future hasn't come yet. You can only control today.

ikaru_na.description: Anger depletes your energy and harms your health. Accept your emotions but let them go.

shinpai_suna.description: Worry is giving energy to things that haven't happened. Live with trust and surrender.

kansha_shite.description: Gratitude is one of the highest vibrations. Find a blessing in everything.

gyo_wo_hageme.description: Whatever work you do, do it with integrity and dedication. Add meaning to your life.

hito_ni_shinsetsu_ni.description: Compassion and kindness are universal healing energies. Be kind to everyone, including yourself.

heart.name: Heart Chakra
heart.reiki_position: Place hands on center of chest

throat.name: Throat Chakra
throat.reiki_position: Place hands on either side of throat

crown.name: Crown Chakra
crown.reiki_position: Place hands on top of head

self_reiki.title: Self-Reiki Practice
steps: Sit or lie in a comfortable position
Close your eyes and take several deep breaths
Set your intention: "I open myself to healing energy"
Place hands on top of your head (3-5 min)
Place hands over your eyes (3-5 min)
Place hands on your throat (3-5 min)
Place hands on your heart (3-5 min)
Place hands on solar plexus (3-5 min)
Place hands below navel (3-5 min)
Finish with gratitude

daily_cleansing.title: Daily Energy Cleansing
steps: Rub your hands together when you wake up
Feel your hands warming and energy flowing
Cleanse your energy field by moving hands around your aura
Release negative energy into the ground
Start the day with positive intentions

distance_reiki.title: Distance Reiki
steps: Get permission from the person you'll send healing to (mentally)
Visualize the person or situation
Draw the Hon Sha Ze Sho Nen symbol (if applicable)
Send love and healing intention
Feel the energy reaching them
Finish with gratitude

reiki.tip: Working with a Reiki master is recommended for Reiki attunement. These practices can help develop energy awareness even if you haven't been attuned.

progressions.title: Progressions
progressions.enter_birth_info: Please enter your birth information first
progressions.info_banner: Secondary progressions show your inner evolution. One day after birth equals one year of life.
progressions.name: Name
progressions.kadim_content: Secondary progressions are one of the oldest techniques for understanding personal evolution. Based on the principle that each day after birth corresponds to a year of life, they reveal the inner psychological evolution of the soul.

breath_awareness.name: Breath Awareness
breath_awareness.instruction: Close your eyes. Take three deep breaths. With each breath, say 'I am here now.'

heart_listening.name: Heart Listening
heart_listening.instruction: Place your hand on your heart. For one minute, just listen to the sound of your heart.

flow_intention.name: Flow Intention
flow_intention.instruction: Today, instead of forcing something, let it flow. Just watch what happens.
flow_intention.intention: When control is released, flow begins.

gratitude_moment.name: Gratitude Moment
gratitude_moment.instruction: Count three things you're grateful for today. Feel them.

silence_minute.name: Silence Minute
silence_minute.instruction: Do nothing for one minute. Just be.

intention_setting.name: Intention Setting
intention_setting.instruction: Set a single intention for today. Repeat it three times in your mind.

body_scan.name: Body Scan
body_scan.instruction: Scan your body from toes to head. Notice the tense areas.

zodiac.discover_all_signs: Discover all 12 signs and read daily horoscopes

jupiter.line1: {planet} in {sign} - your growth and expansion area is colored by this sign's energy.
jupiter.line2: {sign}'s qualities show how you expand, what you believe in, and where you find opportunity. Your philosophical outlook, learning style, and optimism toward life are shaped by this sign.
jupiter.line3: {meaning} areas have {sign} energy active. This placement shows your spiritual growth potential and how abundance flows in your life.

saturn.line1: {planet} in {sign} - responsibility and boundaries find expression through this sign's energy.
saturn.line2: {sign}'s qualities show which areas you need to mature in, your fears, and life lessons. Your discipline style, authority relationship, and time understanding are shaped by this sign.
saturn.line3: {meaning} areas have {sign} energy active. This placement shows your karma and mastery journey.

uranus.line1: {planet} in {sign} - originality and revolution find expression through this sign's energy.
uranus.line2: {sign}'s qualities show where you want to be free, areas where you're different, and your innovative potential. Your rebellious spirit and visionary nature are shaped by this sign.
uranus.line3: {meaning} areas have {sign} energy active. This is a generational placement - collective energy shared with your age group.

neptune.line1: {planet} in {sign} - dreams and intuition find expression through this sign's energy.
neptune.line2: {sign}'s qualities show your spiritual tendencies, creative inspiration, and areas of illusion. Your imagination and spiritual connection are shaped by this sign.
neptune.line3: {meaning} areas have {sign} energy active. This is a generational placement - reflecting collective dreams and spiritual trends.

pluto.line1: {planet} in {sign} - transformation and power find expression through this sign's energy.
pluto.line2: {sign}'s qualities show deep transformation areas, shadow work topics, and rebirth potential. Your psychological depth is shaped by this sign.
pluto.line3: {meaning} areas have {sign} energy active. This is a generational placement - reflecting collective transformation and power dynamics.

north_node.line1: {planet} in {sign} - your soul's lesson to learn in this life relates to this sign.
north_node.line2: Developing {sign} energy is the main theme of your evolutionary journey in this life. This sign shows the goal you need to reach by stepping out of your comfort zone.
north_node.line3: Letting go of habits from the opposite sign of the South Node and embracing {sign}'s qualities is critical for your spiritual growth.

south_node.line1: {planet} in {sign} - talents and habits you brought from past lives.
south_node.line2: {sign} energy is innate in you - but this comfort zone can also block your growth. Holding too tightly to this sign's qualities can slow your evolutionary development.
south_node.line3: You need to balance {sign} habits to move toward your North Node.

chiron.line1: {planet} in {sign} - your deepest wound and healing potential is connected to this sign.
chiron.line2: Traumas or painful experiences in {sign} areas can paradoxically transform into the power to heal others. The 'wounded healer' archetype is active for you in this sign.
chiron.line3: Accepting and making peace with this wound reveals both your own healing and capacity to help others.

lilith.line1: {planet} in {sign} - your suppressed desires and shadow side relate to this sign.
lilith.line2: In {sign} areas, there are desires that are socially unaccepted or suppressed. Rather than rejecting this energy, integrating it in a healthy way is important for you.
lilith.line3: Black Moon represents wild, untamed feminine energy - how does this energy want to find expression in {sign} sign?

interpretations.default: {planet} in {sign} - {meaning} areas have this sign's energy active.
interpretations.retrograde: Retrograde: This planet's energy is inward and in a re-evaluation process. In {planet} areas, reviewing the past, deepening, and inner work are prominent.

houses.title: Astrological Houses
houses.subtitle: 12 astrological houses and life areas
houses.section_subtitle: Discover different areas of your life
houses.view_house_on_chart: View This House on My Chart
houses.planet_single: {planet} is positioned in this house - {area} is strengthened with {energy} energy.
houses.planet_multiple: There are {count} planets in this house: {planets}. {area} is active and intense with multiple planetary energies.

1.title: 1st House - House of Self
1.description: Represents your personality, physical appearance and how you present yourself to the world. The rising sign rules this house.

2.title: 2nd House - House of Money & Values
2.description: Represents your material values, ability to earn money and self-worth.

3.title: 3rd House - House of Communication
3.description: Represents your thinking style, communication skills and relationships with your close environment.

4.title: 4th House - House of Family & Roots
4.description: Represents your family, home, emotional foundations and the later period of your life.

5.title: 5th House - House of Creativity & Love
5.description: Represents your creative expression, romance, children and sense of entertainment.

6.title: 6th House - House of Health & Service
6.description: Represents your daily routines, work habits and physical health.

7.title: 7th House - House of Marriage & Partnership
7.description: Represents your serious relationships, marriage and all types of partnerships.

8.title: 8th House - House of Transformation
8.description: Represents deep transformation, shared resources, sexuality and spiritual rebirth.

9.title: 9th House - House of Philosophy & Travel
9.description: Represents higher education, long journeys, philosophy and spiritual quest.

10.title: 10th House - House of Career & Status
10.description: Represents your career, social status, goals and achievements.

11.title: 11th House - House of Friends & Ideals
11.description: Represents your friendships, social groups, future hopes and ideals.

12.title: 12th House - House of Subconscious & Secrets
12.description: Represents your subconscious, hidden enemies, spiritual journey and karmic lessons.

houses.birth_time_required_desc: Accurate birth time is needed to calculate house positions
houses.no_planets_info: No planets in this house - this doesn't mean this area is inactive. The sign ruling this house and its ruler planet show how this area operates in your life.

1.title: Gate of Self
1.description: The first house is your soul's first touch to this world - the first breath, the first glance, the first sense of 'I'. This house is your 'cosmic mask'; it shows how your soul chooses to present itself to the world. {signName} here as rising colors your approach to life, your physical appearance and how others first perceive you.
1.shadow: Shadow aspect: Hiding behind the mask, placing excessive importance on appearance.
1.gift: Gift: The ability to experience every moment as a new beginning.

2.title: Temple of Values
2.description: The second house is the sacred temple of the material world. Money is not just paper - it's a reflection of your value system. {signName} positioned in this house shapes your earning style, what you value and your need for security. This house carries the spiritual dimension of the verb 'to possess'.
2.shadow: Shadow aspect: Seeking security only in material things, greed or excessive thriftiness.
2.gift: Gift: Developing abundance consciousness and using resources wisely.

3.title: Garden of the Mind
3.description: The third house is the sacred space of mind and communication. {signName} here determines your thinking style, speaking manner and way of learning. This house also governs relationships with siblings, neighbors and close environment. Here the mind becomes either a garden or a forest - the seeds you plant grow.
3.shadow: Shadow aspect: Superficiality, gossip, scattered attention.
3.gift: Gift: The power to unite worlds through words.

4.title: Root of the Soul
4.description: The fourth house is the deepest point of the chart - the root of your soul. {signName} here shapes family patterns, the need for emotional security and the concept of 'home'. This house carries the legacy of ancestors and the oldest impressions in your subconscious. You cannot understand where you're going without knowing where you came from.
4.shadow: Shadow aspect: Getting stuck in the past, blindly repeating family patterns.
4.gift: Gift: Deep emotional wisdom and capacity for inner peace.

5.title: Creator's Stage
5.description: The fifth house is the stage where your soul finds creative expression. {signName} here colors your creativity style, romantic expression, relationship with children and approach to 'play'. This house is where the joy of the heart springs forth - the home of the child within.
5.shadow: Shadow aspect: Ego inflation, attention addiction, risky behaviors.
5.gift: Gift: Pure creative energy and the ability to inspire others.

6.title: Workshop of Service
6.description: The sixth house is the home of daily life's sacred rituals. {signName} here determines work routines, health habits and approach to service. This house carries the answer to 'how do I serve?' Your body is a temple - the sixth house is its care manual.
6.shadow: Shadow aspect: Obsessive perfectionism, serving others while neglecting yourself.
6.gift: Gift: The capacity to create order and healing.

7.title: Beyond the Mirror
7.description: The seventh house is the mirror of the 'other' - the home of relationships, partnerships and marriage. {signName} here shapes the qualities you seek in partners, your relationship style and the concept of 'we'. Everyone who appears before you reflects something inside you - this house is that mirror.
7.shadow: Shadow aspect: Defining yourself through relationships, codependent relationships.
7.gift: Gift: Creating deep connections and seeing yourself in others.

8.title: Well of Transformation
8.description: The eighth house is the home of the death-rebirth cycle - the place of deepest transformations. {signName} here determines your coping style with crises, shared resources, sexuality and approach to mysteries. This house requires the courage to face shadows.
8.shadow: Shadow aspect: Control obsession, manipulation, fear of loss.
8.gift: Gift: The power to rise again from every pile of ashes like a phoenix.

9.title: Quest for Truth
9.description: The ninth house is the home of the search for meaning - philosophy, higher education, distant journeys and spiritual expansion. {signName} here shapes your belief system, teaching/learning style and way of seeing the 'big picture'. This house pursues the question 'why?'
9.shadow: Shadow aspect: Dogmatism, blind faith, inability to stay in place.
9.gift: Gift: Distilling wisdom from experience and enlightening others.

10.title: Crown of the Peak
10.description: The tenth house is the zenith of the chart - the home of career, social status and life mission. {signName} here determines the mark you want to leave in the world, your career style and relationship with authority figures. This house is the answer to 'who do I want to be in the world?'
10.shadow: Shadow aspect: Status obsession, workaholism, sacrifice for success.
10.gift: Gift: The capacity to leave a lasting and meaningful mark in the world.

11.title: Collective of Dreams
11.description: The eleventh house is the home of collective dreams, ideals and friendships. {signName} here shapes your social circle, group dynamics and vision for the future. This house is about finding your 'tribe' - what you cannot change alone, you transform together.
11.shadow: Shadow aspect: Losing individuality for group conformity, utopian dreams.
11.gift: Gift: Maintaining individual uniqueness while serving the collective good.

12.title: Gateway to Infinity
12.description: The twelfth house is the most mysterious corner of the chart - the home of the subconscious, spirituality, karma and dissolution. {signName} here carries subconscious patterns, your spiritual journey and 'letting go' lessons. This house is the gateway beyond ego, to infinity.
12.shadow: Shadow aspect: Tendency to escape, victim role, disconnection from reality.
12.gift: Gift: Boundless compassion and the experience of universal unity.

zodiac_advice.aries: Advice: Write down your first thoughts when you wake up in the morning. Your fire energy can quickly make you forget subconscious messages.
zodiac_advice.taurus: Advice: Write your dreams in a dream journal. Your earth energy works better with tangible records.
zodiac_advice.gemini: Advice: Tell your dream to someone. Your air energy loves to find meaning through verbal expression.
zodiac_advice.cancer: Advice: Pay attention to moon phases. Your dreams will be stronger during full moon and new moon times.
zodiac_advice.leo: Advice: Express your dreams creatively - draw, write, share. Your fire energy loves expression.
zodiac_advice.virgo: Advice: Keep a list of dream symbols. Your earth energy appreciates systematic analysis.
zodiac_advice.libra: Advice: Focus on relationships in your dreams. Your air energy draws lessons from social dynamics.
zodiac_advice.scorpio: Advice: Do deep meditation. Your water energy is very powerful for diving into subconscious depths.
zodiac_advice.sagittarius: Advice: Interpret your dreams philosophically. Your fire energy loves to see the big picture.
zodiac_advice.capricorn: Advice: Think about how to apply your dreams to practical life. Your earth energy wants concrete results.
zodiac_advice.aquarius: Advice: Join dream communities. Your air energy is nourished by collective wisdom.
zodiac_advice.pisces: Advice: Set intention before sleep. Your water energy can connect directly with spiritual guidance.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.zodiac_subtitle: Most frequently asked questions and answers
faq.birth_chart_subtitle: Everything you wonder about natal charts
faq.tarot_subtitle: What you need to know about tarot cards
faq.zodiac_a1: {sign} is one of the zodiac signs. Each sign has unique personality traits, strengths and weaknesses. Even if your Sun sign is {sign}, your rising sign and Moon sign also significantly influence your personality.
faq.zodiac_a2: Sign compatibility depends on the entire birth chart, not just Sun signs. Generally, signs in the same element group (fire, earth, air, water) tend to be more compatible. For detailed compatibility analysis, synastry (comparative chart) analysis is recommended.
faq.zodiac_a3: Daily horoscopes reflect general cosmic energies. Since each individual's birth chart is unique, personalized readings through birth chart analysis and transit reports provide more accurate results.
faq.zodiac_q4: What does it mean if my rising sign is {sign}?
faq.zodiac_a4: The rising sign (Ascendant) is the sign that was rising on the eastern horizon at your birth moment. It represents your outer appearance, how others perceive you, and your approach to life. You need to know your birth time to find your rising sign.
faq.birth_chart_a1: A birth chart (natal chart) is a cosmic map showing the positions of planets in the sky at the moment you were born. It shows which signs and houses the Sun, Moon and planets were in, and the aspects they make to each other.
faq.birth_chart_q2: What do I need to calculate a birth chart?
faq.birth_chart_a2: To calculate a birth chart, you need your birth date, birth time, and birth place. The more precise your birth time, the more accurately your rising sign and house placements can be calculated.
faq.birth_chart_q3: What if I don't know my birth time?
faq.birth_chart_a3: When birth time is unknown, noon (12:00) is typically used. In this case, the Moon sign and rising sign may be inaccurate. Planet sign placements and aspects between them will still be accurate.
faq.birth_chart_q4: What is the difference between house systems (Placidus, Whole Sign)?
faq.birth_chart_a4: Different house systems use different mathematical methods to divide the sky into 12 houses. Placidus is the most commonly used system. Whole Sign is an ancient system where each sign represents one house. Both systems are valid.
faq.tarot_q1: Do tarot cards show the future?
faq.tarot_a1: Tarot cards don't show a definite future, but rather your current energy field and possibilities. The cards work like a mirror - reflecting your subconscious and situation. The future is shaped by your decisions and actions.
faq.tarot_q2: How many cards are in a tarot deck?
faq.tarot_a2: A standard tarot deck consists of 78 cards: 22 Major Arcana (great secrets) and 56 Minor Arcana (lesser secrets). The Minor Arcana has four suits (Wands, Cups, Swords, Pentacles) with 14 cards each.
faq.tarot_a3: Reversed cards can indicate that the card's energy is blocked, internalized, or excessive. Some tarot readers don't use reversed cards, while others consider them an important nuance.
faq.tarot_q4: Can I read tarot for myself?
faq.tarot_a4: Yes, you can read tarot for yourself. The important thing is to set a clear intention and interpret the cards objectively. Daily card pulls are an excellent practice for self-discovery.
faq.numerology_a1: Numerology is an ancient wisdom system that studies the symbolic and spiritual meanings of numbers. It is believed that the numbers in your birth date and name provide information about your life path, personality, and potential.
faq.numerology_q2: How is the life path number calculated?
faq.numerology_a2: Your life path number is found by reducing all digits in your birth date to a single digit (or master numbers like 11, 22, 33). Example: 15.05.1990 = 1+5+0+5+1+9+9+0 = 30 = 3+0 = 3
faq.numerology_a3: Master numbers are powerful vibrations that carry special potential and challenges. 11 represents intuitive enlightenment, 22 the master builder, and 33 the master teacher. These numbers are not reduced to single digits.
faq.numerology_a4: Each letter has a numerical value (in the Pythagorean or Chaldean system). By adding up the numerical values of the letters in your name, your expression number, soul number, and personality number are calculated.

insight.title: Insight
insight.intro: I'm here to help you reflect on what's on your mind. Whether it's a dream, a feeling, a decision, or just something you want to explore - I'm here to listen and ask questions that might help you see things from a new angle.
insight.disclaimer: This is a space for personal reflection, not advice.
insight.error: Something went wrong. Please try again.

welcome.morning: Good morning! What would you like to reflect on today?
welcome.afternoon: Good afternoon! What's on your mind?
welcome.evening: Good evening! Ready for some reflection?

responses.dream_falling:
Falling dreams are among the most common experiences people report. Many find these dreams surface during times when they're navigating uncertainty or feeling like aspects of life are beyond their control.

I'm curious whether this dream has been recurring - the pattern itself might be worth exploring. What's been happening in your waking life lately? Sometimes our minds process daytime concerns through nighttime imagery.

What does falling feel like in the dream - is it frightening, freeing, or something else entirely?
responses.dream_water:
Water dreams are something many people experience. Water can represent different things for different people - sometimes emotions, sometimes change, sometimes cleansing.

What was the water like in your dream? Was it calm, turbulent, deep, shallow? The specific qualities might connect to what's happening in your waking life.

How did you feel during the dream?
responses.dream_flying:
Flying dreams are among the most memorable dream experiences. Many people associate them with feelings of freedom, gaining perspective, or escaping limitations.

Was the flight effortless or were you struggling? Were you flying high or staying close to the ground? These details might hold personal meaning for you.

How did you feel while flying - exhilarated, scared, in control?
responses.dream_chase:
Being chased in dreams is something many people experience. It often surfaces when we're feeling pressured or avoiding something in waking life.

Do you remember what was chasing you? And were you able to escape or were you caught? These details might be worth exploring for what they mean to you.

Is there anything that's been "chasing" you in your mind lately - something you've been avoiding?
responses.dream_teeth:
Teeth dreams are among the most commonly reported dream themes. Different people experience them differently - some see teeth falling out, some breaking, some loose.

Many people associate these dreams with concerns about self-image, communication, or some kind of transition in their lives.

What exactly happened in the dream, and how did it make you feel?
responses.dream_general_1:
Thank you for sharing your dream. Dreams can be a way our mind processes thoughts and feelings that our waking mind doesn't always get to address.

What was the dominant feeling during the dream? And do you sense any connection to what's been happening in your life recently?

What part of the dream stayed with you most?
responses.dream_general_2:
That's an interesting dream experience. Dreams are often our subconscious mind's way of processing our thoughts and experiences.

What was the most vivid part of the dream? And how did you feel when you woke up - relieved, unsettled, curious?

Has anything happened recently that might have triggered this dream?
responses.pattern_1:
Noticing a pattern is a powerful sign of self-awareness. Many people live inside cycles without ever recognizing them.

Do you remember when this pattern first started? And what feelings or situations typically accompany this pattern?

How do you feel when you notice yourself in this pattern?
responses.pattern_2:
Patterns often try to tell us something - recurring behaviors or situations usually connect to a deeper need or belief.

What does this pattern give you? Sometimes the things we repeat serve us in some way, even if it's hard to recognize.

If you wanted to break this cycle, what would your first step be?
responses.emotion_anxiety:
Anxiety can be a challenging feeling to sit with. It's often our body's way of saying something needs our attention - even if it's not always accurate.

Where do you feel the anxiety most - in your body, your thoughts, or both? And what typically triggers it?

Is there anything that's been helping you cope with this anxiety right now?
responses.emotion_sadness:
Sadness is a natural emotion that helps us process our experiences. Sometimes it signals that something matters to us.

When did this sadness start? And do you know what it's connected to - a specific event, or is it more of a general feeling?

How are you taking care of yourself right now?
responses.emotion_anger:
Anger often signals that our boundaries have been crossed or that we sense something isn't fair. It's an important emotion to pay attention to.

What do you think is at the root of this anger? And how do you typically express this feeling - do you hold it in or let it out?

Could there be other feelings underneath this anger?
responses.emotion_overwhelmed:
Feeling overwhelmed is a signal that we're facing demands that exceed our current capacity. This feeling is valid and something many people experience.

Can you identify what feels most overwhelming right now? Sometimes naming just one thing can make things feel more manageable.

Have you had a chance to take a breath?
responses.emotion_general:
Being in touch with your emotions is an important self-awareness skill. Whatever you're feeling is valid.

How long has this feeling been present? And where do you feel it in your body?

What do you need most right now?
responses.decision_1:
Decision-making can be challenging, especially when there are multiple valid options. Being able to see both sides is actually a sign of thoughtful consideration.

If you imagined the best outcome of each choice, which one excites you more? And what would be the worst outcome of each?

What does your gut tell you?
responses.decision_2:
Decisions often require us to balance multiple values at once. Could there be conflicting values that make this decision feel difficult?

Looking back a year from now, which choice would you want to have made?

What's preventing you from seeing this decision more clearly?
responses.relationship_1:
Relationships can be some of the most meaningful yet challenging aspects of our lives. Each relationship has its own dynamics.

What are you feeling most in this relationship right now? And do you know what you're hoping for from this relationship?

In an ideal scenario, what would this relationship look like?
responses.relationship_2:
Challenges in relationships often reveal something about our needs or boundaries.

What matters most to you in this situation? And have you been able to express that to the other person?

How do you feel about yourself in this relationship?
responses.self_discovery_1:
The journey of self-discovery is a lifelong process. Asking questions shows you're already on this path.

When do you feel most like yourself in life? And when do you struggle to feel like yourself?

How would someone who knows you best describe you?
responses.self_discovery_2:
Discovering who we are takes courage. Every experience teaches us something about ourselves.

Have you ever thought about what your values - what you truly care about - are?

What would you change in your life right now?
responses.general_1:
Thank you for sharing what's on your mind. Sometimes just putting thoughts into words can help us see them more clearly.

What's been weighing on you the most? And how long has this been on your mind?

What outcome would you hope for?
responses.general_2:
It sounds like you have a lot going on. Taking time to reflect is a valuable practice.

If you could change one thing about this situation, what would it be?

What support do you need right now?

sign_summaries.aries: [[Aries]] is the first sign of the [[Zodiac]] and carries [[Cardinal]] [[Fire]] energy. Ruled by [[Mars]], it has a strong drive toward action, leadership, and new beginnings.
sign_summaries.taurus: [[Taurus]] represents stability and security with [[Fixed]] [[Earth]] energy. Under [[Venus]] rule, beauty, value, and material comfort are the main motivations.
sign_summaries.gemini: [[Gemini]] represents communication and intelligence with [[Mutable]] [[Air]] energy. Under [[Mercury]] rule, learning and sharing knowledge is vital.
sign_summaries.cancer: [[Cancer]] represents emotional depth and protection with [[Cardinal]] [[Water]] energy. Under [[Moon]] rule, home and family are the most important themes.
sign_summaries.leo: [[Leo]] represents creativity and free will with [[Fixed]] [[Fire]] energy. Under [[Sun]] rule, self-expression and shining is your natural tendency.
sign_summaries.virgo: [[Virgo]] represents analysis and service with [[Mutable]] [[Earth]] energy. Under [[Mercury]] rule, details and perfection are important.
sign_summaries.libra: [[Libra]] represents balance and relationships with [[Cardinal]] [[Air]] energy. Under [[Venus]] rule, harmony and aesthetics are core values.
sign_summaries.scorpio: [[Scorpio]] represents transformation and intensity with [[Fixed]] [[Water]] energy. Under [[Pluto]] rule, depth and power themes are prominent.
sign_summaries.sagittarius: [[Sagittarius]] represents adventure and philosophy with [[Mutable]] [[Fire]] energy. Under [[Jupiter]] rule, expansion and search for meaning is your natural state.
sign_summaries.capricorn: [[Capricorn]] represents success and discipline with [[Cardinal]] [[Earth]] energy. Under [[Saturn]] rule, structure and responsibility are core values.
sign_summaries.aquarius: [[Aquarius]] represents innovation and humanity with [[Fixed]] [[Air]] energy. Under [[Uranus]] rule, freedom and progress are the most important themes.
sign_summaries.pisces: [[Pisces]] represents spirituality and intuition with [[Mutable]] [[Water]] energy. Under [[Neptune]] rule, imagination and empathy are your strengths.
sign_summaries.default: Loading detailed information about this sign...

deep_interpretations.aries:
[[Aries]] is located at the starting point of the [[Zodiac]] circle and represents the "I am" principle. This period, beginning with the [[Spring equinox]], reflects the energy of rebirth and growth in nature.

Under the rule of planet [[Mars]], Aries are action-oriented. Their natural relationship with the [[1st House]] determines identity, physical appearance, and how one approaches the world. The [[Fire]] element provides courage and passion, while the [[Cardinal]] quality brings leadership and initiative.

In evolutionary astrology, Aries represents the beginning of the [[Soul's journey]]. It takes the first steps in ego development and the individuation process. [[Shadow]] aspects include impatience and acting without thinking.

Planets in Aries generally display fast, direct, and competitive energy. During [[Mars]] [[Retrograde]] periods, it's beneficial to direct this energy toward inner motivation.
deep_interpretations.taurus:
[[Taurus]] is the second sign of the [[Zodiac]] and represents the "I have" principle. As the most stable form of the [[Earth]] element, Taurus manages values and resources.

Under the rule of planet [[Venus]], Taurus shows deep appreciation for sensory experiences and beauty. Their natural relationship with the [[2nd House]] covers self-worth, material resources, and talents.

The [[Fixed]] quality gives Taurus endurance and determination. Once started, projects continue until completion. However, this can also lead to the [[Shadow]] aspect of stubbornness.

Planets in Taurus display slow but determined energy. [[Venus]] transits indicate important periods especially for Taurus and [[Libra]] signs.
deep_interpretations.gemini:
[[Gemini]] represents the "I think" principle and is the first [[Air]] sign of the [[Zodiac]]. Under [[Mercury]] rule, mental agility and communication abilities are strong.

Their natural relationship with the [[3rd House]] covers immediate environment, siblings, short trips, and basic communication. The [[Mutable]] quality provides the ability to adapt and be flexible.

Gemini's [[Duality]] symbolism - twin siblings - represents the two aspects of the mind: rational and intuitive. This energy, sometimes perceived as scattered, is actually the ability to see multiple perspectives.

[[Mercury Retrograde]] periods are especially important for Gemini. These times are valuable for introspection and looking back. The [[Shadow]] aspect is superficiality and indecisiveness.
deep_interpretations.cancer:
[[Cancer]] is the fourth sign of the [[Zodiac]] and represents the [[Cardinal]] form of the [[Water]] element. With the "I feel" principle, it embodies emotional intelligence and intuition.

Under [[Moon]] rule, Cancers display emotional depth and protective instincts. Their natural relationship with the [[4th House]] covers home, family roots, inner world, and emotional security.

The [[Mother archetype]] resonates strongly with Cancer. Nurturing energy and caregiving ability are naturally developed. [[Moon phases]] are especially effective for Cancer natives.

[[Shadow]] aspects include overprotection, emotional manipulation, and tendency to get stuck in the past. Learning to set [[Emotional boundaries]] is the evolutionary task.
deep_interpretations.leo:
[[Leo]] is the fifth sign of the [[Zodiac]] and represents the [[Fixed]] form of the [[Fire]] element. With the "I create" principle, self-expression and creativity are central.

The [[Sun]] is the ruler of this sign and is "at home" - in its strongest state. Their natural relationship with the [[5th House]] covers creativity, romance, children, and entertainment. The [[Heart chakra]] is strongly connected to Leo.

Leo's attraction to drama and the stage stems from a spiritual need: to be seen and feel valued. This is not an ego matter, but the natural expression of the [[Sun]].

[[Shadow]] aspects include arrogance, excessive pride, and tendency to ignore others' light. Humility and sharing are qualities to develop on the evolutionary journey.
deep_interpretations.virgo:
[[Virgo]] is the sixth sign of the [[Zodiac]] and represents the [[Mutable]] form of the [[Earth]] element. With the "I analyze" principle, service and pursuit of perfection are central.

Under [[Mercury]] rule, Virgo displays analytical intelligence and detail orientation. Their natural relationship with the [[6th House]] covers health, daily routines, service, and work environment.

Virgo's perfectionist tendency actually comes from the concept of [[Sacred service]] - the desire to do one's job in the best way. [[Healing]] abilities are generally strong.

[[Shadow]] aspects include being overly critical, worry, and self-deprecation. Accepting oneself and freeing from the pressure of flawlessness is the evolutionary task.
deep_interpretations.libra:
[[Libra]] is the seventh sign of the [[Zodiac]] and represents the [[Cardinal]] form of the [[Air]] element. With the "I balance" principle, relationship and harmony are central.

Under [[Venus]] rule, Libra displays aesthetic sensitivity and social grace. Their natural relationship with the [[7th House]] covers partnerships, marriage, and the concept of "the other."

Libra's search for balance actually comes from the concept of [[Cosmic justice]]. Understanding the [[Projection]] mechanism is important for this sign - what we see in others belongs to us.

The [[Sun]] is "in fall" in this sign - individuality themes can be challenging. [[Shadow]] aspects include indecisiveness, passive-aggressive behaviors, and avoiding conflict. Developing self-identity is the evolutionary task.
deep_interpretations.scorpio:
[[Scorpio]] is the eighth sign of the [[Zodiac]] and represents the [[Fixed]] form of the [[Water]] element. With the "I transform" principle, depth and power are central.

Under [[Pluto]] (modern) and [[Mars]] (traditional) rule, Scorpio displays intense emotional depth and penetrative intelligence. Their natural relationship with the [[8th House]] covers shared resources, sexuality, death-rebirth, and psychological transformation.

Scorpio's intensity actually comes from [[Spiritual alchemy]] - the desire to turn lead into gold. [[Kundalini]] energy is strongly related to this sign.

[[Shadow]] aspects include jealousy, obsession, revenge, and need for control. Letting go and trusting are the most important lessons on the evolutionary journey.
deep_interpretations.sagittarius:
[[Sagittarius]] is the ninth sign of the [[Zodiac]] and represents the [[Mutable]] form of the [[Fire]] element. With the "I explore" principle, freedom and search for meaning are central.

Under [[Jupiter]] rule, Sagittarius displays optimism, generosity, and expansion energy. Their natural relationship with the [[9th House]] covers long journeys, higher education, philosophy, and belief systems.

The archer symbolism of Sagittarius - bow and arrow - represents goal-oriented vision and high ideals. [[Centaur]] mythology symbolizes the union of human and animal nature.

[[Shadow]] aspects include excessive optimism, scatteredness, irresponsibility, and not keeping promises. Deepening and commitment are evolutionary tasks.
deep_interpretations.capricorn:
[[Capricorn]] is the tenth sign of the [[Zodiac]] and represents the [[Cardinal]] form of the [[Earth]] element. With the "I achieve" principle, discipline and responsibility are central.

Under [[Saturn]] rule, Capricorn works with themes of structure, time, and maturity. Their natural relationship with the [[10th House]] covers career, social status, reputation, and the [[Father archetype]].

Capricorn's mountain goat symbolism represents determination to climb challenging peaks and reach the goal. Time is this sign's ally - wisdom and success increase with age.

[[Saturn Return]] (approximately every 29 years) is especially meaningful for Capricorns. [[Shadow]] aspects include rigidity, pessimism, and excessive seriousness. Joy and flexibility are evolutionary tasks.
deep_interpretations.aquarius:
[[Aquarius]] is the eleventh sign of the [[Zodiac]] and represents the [[Fixed]] form of the [[Air]] element. With the "I know" principle, innovation and humanity are central.

Under [[Uranus]] (modern) and [[Saturn]] (traditional) rule, Aquarius works with revolutionary ideas and social consciousness. Their natural relationship with the [[11th House]] covers groups, friendships, hopes, and humanitarian ideals.

The water-bearer symbolism of Aquarius represents the distribution of wisdom to humanity. [[Collective consciousness]] and future-oriented vision are strongly related to this sign.

[[Shadow]] aspects include emotional distance, excessive intellectualism, and neglecting individuals while thinking "for everyone." Emotional closeness is the evolutionary task.
deep_interpretations.pisces:
[[Pisces]] is the twelfth and last sign of the [[Zodiac]] and represents the [[Mutable]] form of the [[Water]] element. With the "I believe" principle, spirituality and transcendence are central.

Under [[Neptune]] (modern) and [[Jupiter]] (traditional) rule, Pisces works with mysticism, empathy, and cosmic consciousness. Their natural relationship with the [[12th House]] covers the unconscious, spiritual practices, seclusion, and [[Karmic]] themes.

The two fish symbolism of Pisces - swimming in opposite directions - represents the tension between material and spiritual worlds. Direct access to the [[Collective unconscious]] is this sign's gift.

[[Shadow]] aspects include escape tendencies (addiction), lack of boundaries, and victim mentality. Healthy boundaries and connection with reality are evolutionary tasks.

life_path.title: What is life path number?
life_path.answer1: Life path number is the fundamental numerological number calculated from your birth date.
life_path.answer2: It shows which path you will walk in this life.
life_path.answer3: It ranges from 1 to 9 (and master numbers 11, 22, 33).
life_path.calc1: All digits of your birth date are added together.
life_path.calc2: It is reduced until a single digit is reached.
life_path.tells1: Your soul's purpose in this life.
life_path.tells3: Challenges and lessons you will face.
life_path.note1: Life path number is not destiny.
life_path.note2: It shows potential, decisions are yours.
life_path.note3: Every number has both light and shadow sides.
life_path.suggestion: What does daily number energy tell?

falling.short_answer_1: Falling dreams usually reflect a feeling of loss of control.
falling.short_answer_2: They appear when we feel like things are slipping away from us.
falling.short_answer_3: Waking up while falling is your subconscious's reflex to wake you.
falling.meaning_1: More common during times of uncertainty.
falling.meaning_2: You might be worried about work, relationships, or health.
falling.meaning_3: The speed of the fall shows the intensity of anxiety.
falling.recurring_2: Look at what makes you feel unstable in life.
falling.recurring_3: Accepting what you cannot control can bring relief.

water.short_answer_1: Water symbolizes the subconscious and emotions.
water.short_answer_2: The state of water reflects your inner world.
water.short_answer_3: Calm water shows peace, turbulent water shows turmoil.
water.state_title: What Does the Water's State Tell You?
water.state_1: Clear water: Mental clarity and emotional balance.
water.state_2: Murky water: Uncertainty or suppressed emotions.
water.state_3: Flowing water: Harmony with life's flow.
water.state_4: Still water: Time for introspection and reflection.
water.emotion_1: Swimming: Being at peace with emotions.
water.emotion_2: Falling into water: Emotions taking control.
water.recurring_1: You're trying to process an emotional issue.
water.recurring_2: There may be a need for inner cleansing.
water.recurring_3: You're learning to trust your intuition more.

flying.short_answer_1: Flying dreams reflect the desire for freedom and transcending limits.
flying.short_answer_2: Shows you've taken or want to take control.
flying.short_answer_3: The ease of flight symbolizes the flow in your life.
flying.feeling_1: Enjoyable flight: Confidence and sense of success.
flying.feeling_3: Fear of falling: Insecurity or doubt.
flying.meaning_1: Desire to break free from restrictions.
flying.cant_fly_1: You're struggling to believe in yourself.
flying.cant_fly_2: An obstacle is holding you back.
flying.cant_fly_3: It might be time to let go of control.

running.short_answer_1: Running dreams show the desire to escape from a situation or emotion.
running.short_answer_2: There might be something you're avoiding confronting.
running.short_answer_3: Being caught while running makes you feel escape isn't working.
running.meaning_1: There's a challenging situation in your life.
running.meaning_2: You might be running from responsibility or conflict.
running.meaning_3: What you're running from is usually within yourself.
running.from_1: From someone familiar: Unresolved issue with that person.
running.from_2: From a monster: Your own fears.
running.from_3: From vague danger: General state of anxiety.
running.recurring_1: There's a decision you've been putting off.
running.recurring_2: It might be time to face rather than run.
running.recurring_3: A dream where the escape ends shows the solution has begun.

lost.short_answer_1: Being lost reflects a feeling of losing direction and uncertainty.
lost.short_answer_2: Shows you don't know where life is taking you.
lost.short_answer_3: Could be a search for identity or purpose.
lost.where_1: City: Lost direction in social life.
lost.where_4: Familiar place: You're questioning what you know.
lost.meaning_1: You're struggling to make a decision.
lost.meaning_2: You feel you've lost control of your life.
lost.meaning_3: You're searching for who you are or what you want.
lost.find_2: Getting help: You're open to accepting support.

losing.short_answer_1: Losing someone dreams usually reflect fear of separation.
losing.short_answer_2: Doesn't have to be a real loss, it's a feeling of losing connection.
losing.short_answer_3: There may be unresolved feelings about that person.
losing.who_1: A loved one: Your attachment and fear of loss.
losing.who_2: A stranger: Your connection to yourself.
losing.who_3: A child: Innocence within or new beginnings.
losing.meaning_1: You might be experiencing fear of change.
losing.meaning_2: You feel distance in a relationship.
losing.recurring_1: Your fear of loss may have deepened.
losing.recurring_2: There's something you need to discuss with that person.
losing.recurring_3: You're seeking balance between independence and attachment.

past.short_answer_1: Someone from the past symbolizes unfinished feelings.
past.short_answer_2: It might be about that era, not that person.
past.short_answer_3: The subconscious is processing an old issue.
past.who_3: Someone who passed: Grief process or longing.
past.who_4: Someone from childhood: Past trauma or nostalgia.
past.meaning_1: The emotion you experienced then is still active.
past.meaning_2: A current situation may have triggered the past.
past.meaning_3: It may be time to forgive or let go.
past.recurring_1: You need to resolve something about that person.
past.recurring_2: The past is affecting the present.
past.recurring_3: Time to separate yourself from that era.

searching.short_answer_1: Searching dreams reflect feelings of lack or loss.
searching.short_answer_2: Shows you're chasing something in life.
searching.short_answer_3: What you're searching for explains what you need.
searching.what_1: An object: A lost trait or ability.
searching.what_2: A person: Need for connection or relationship.
searching.what_3: A place: Search for security or belonging.
searching.what_4: Vague: Search for direction in life.
searching.meaning_2: You're looking for answers but don't know where.
searching.meaning_3: You might be in a period of inner searching.
searching.not_found_1: There's something you're not ready for yet.
searching.not_found_2: What you're looking for might be within you.

darkness.short_answer_1: Darkness symbolizes the unknown and unexplored inner world.
darkness.short_answer_2: There may be emotions or thoughts you're not aware of.
darkness.short_answer_3: Can be read as an invitation to discovery, not fear.
darkness.action_title: What Did You Do in the Dark?
darkness.action_3: Were afraid: You're wary of the unknown.
darkness.action_4: Searched for light: Looking for clarity and meaning.
darkness.meaning_1: You're in an uncertain period in life.
darkness.meaning_2: There are parts of yourself you haven't met.
darkness.meaning_3: You're suppressing a secret or hidden emotion.
darkness.recurring_2: You're being invited on an inner journey.
darkness.recurring_3: Light comes after the darkness passes.

voiceless.short_answer_1: Being voiceless reflects feeling unable to express yourself.
voiceless.why_1: Voice didn't come out: Suppressed emotions.
voiceless.why_3: Screamed but nothing came out: Intense frustration.
voiceless.meaning_2: You can't express yourself on some matter.
voiceless.recurring_1: You're struggling to make your voice heard.
voiceless.recurring_3: There's someone you need to talk to.

unable_to_fly.short_answer_1: Being unable to fly reflects feeling you can't use your potential.
unable_to_fly.short_answer_2: You perceive an obstacle or limitation.
unable_to_fly.short_answer_3: You want freedom but something holds you back.
unable_to_fly.why_2: Fear: You're afraid of success or failure.
unable_to_fly.why_3: Falling: You feel a lack of confidence.
unable_to_fly.why_4: Physical obstacle: External conditions limiting you.
unable_to_fly.meaning_1: You're struggling to believe in yourself.
unable_to_fly.meaning_2: You have a fear of missing an opportunity.
unable_to_fly.meaning_3: You might need to let go of control.
unable_to_fly.recurring_2: Your inner critic is too strong.
unable_to_fly.recurring_3: To learn to fly, you must accept falling.

recurring.short_answer_1: Recurring dreams point to an unresolved issue.
recurring.short_answer_2: The subconscious is trying to get your attention.
recurring.short_answer_3: It repeats until the message is understood.
recurring.why_2: An ongoing source of stress in your life.
recurring.what_to_do_1: Note the dream, record the details.
recurring.what_to_do_3: Think about what in life it might connect to.
recurring.what_to_do_4: Try to consciously address the issue.
recurring.when_stops_2: When you take action on the related matter.
recurring.when_stops_3: When you release the emotional burden.

share_screen.default_text: I got lost in my dreams and found myself.
share_screen.default_poetry:
The silent whisper of the universe at night,
Dreams are my soul's reflection in the mirror.
Every symbol a message, every moment a discovery,
A powerful gift from the subconscious.
poetry_templates:
In the depths of the night, {mainSymbol} appeared,
The {archetype} archetype called to my soul.
The encrypted messages of the subconscious,
Now shine in the light of meaning.

The doors of the dream realm opened,
The {mainSymbol} symbol illuminated my path.
Ancient wisdom whispered in my ear,
The energy of {archetype} embraced my whole being.

Shadows dancing in the moonlight,
{mainSymbol} told me stories.
I walk in the footsteps of {archetype},
I've etched my dream's wisdom into my heart.
share_screen.default_affirmation: My dreams guide me, I trust them.
affirmations: I trust the wisdom of my subconscious and understand its messages.
Every dream brings me closer to myself.
I accept my shadows and keep my light shining.
I am open to cosmic guidance and supported on my journey.
default_art_suggestions: Mandala in purple and blue tones
share_screen.write_text_hint: Write the text you want to share...
mystical_quotes_list: "Dreams are letters written by our souls at night."
"Every dream is a mirror, every symbol a key."
"Night is when the subconscious speaks loudest."
"Those who listen to their dreams write their destiny."

symbol_acknowledgments.snake: The snake is one of the most powerful and multilayered symbols in dreams. It can carry many meanings such as transformation, healing, hidden knowledge, or inner threats.
symbol_acknowledgments.water: Water is a universal symbol representing emotional state and the subconscious in dreams. The state of water - calm, turbulent, clear or murky - carries important clues.
symbol_acknowledgments.flying: Flying is a powerful experience in dreams that can point to themes of freedom, high goals, or escape from reality.
symbol_acknowledgments.falling: Falling dreams can reflect fears of losing control, insecurity, or felt before a major change.
symbol_acknowledgments.teeth: Teeth dreams may be related to loss, change, appearance concerns, or communication issues.
symbol_acknowledgments.death: Death dreams are often not literal. They can symbolize transformation, the end of a period, or a major change.
symbol_acknowledgments.being_chased: Being chased dreams can represent emotions, responsibilities, or fears that are being avoided.
symbol_acknowledgments.baby: Baby dreams can symbolize new beginnings, creative projects, or your connection to your inner child.
symbol_acknowledgments.house: A house in dreams is seen as a reflection of the self and inner world. The condition of the house and rooms can represent different life areas.
symbol_acknowledgments.car: Car dreams point to themes of control, direction, and progress on life's journey.
symbol_acknowledgments.dog: A dog can represent loyalty, friendship, or our instinctive sides. The dog's behavior carries important clues.
symbol_acknowledgments.cat: A cat is associated with independence, intuition, and mystery. It can also symbolize feminine energy and inner wisdom.
symbol_acknowledgments.money: Money dreams may reflect themes of value, self-worth, and access to resources.
symbol_acknowledgments.exam: Exam dreams may be about performance anxiety, fear of judgment, or life tests.
symbol_acknowledgments.nakedness: Nakedness dreams are related to vulnerability, expression of authentic self, or shedding masks.
symbol_acknowledgments.getting_lost: Getting lost dreams may reflect feelings of losing direction in life, identity searching, or uncertainty.
symbol_acknowledgments.fire: Fire can represent passion, anger, transformation, or purification. Whether the fire is controlled or uncontrolled is important.
symbol_acknowledgments.blood: Blood can point to themes related to life energy, emotional wounds, or family ties.
symbol_acknowledgments.wedding: Wedding/bride dreams can symbolize union, commitment, or transition to a new phase of life.
symbol_acknowledgments.illness: Illness dreams may point to emotional or spiritual imbalances, areas that need attention.
symbol_acknowledgments.general: Every dream symbol carries personal meaning. What's important is discovering what this symbol means to you.

snake: Was the snake coming toward you, just sitting there, or moving away?
What was the dominant feeling? (fear, tension, curiosity, calm)
Was the environment enclosed (room/house) or open (nature)?
falling: Did the fall feel like losing control or like letting go?
Did you hit the ground or wake up mid-fall?
Was the fall from a great height or short?
being_chased: Who or what was chasing you? (clear or unclear)
What was the dominant feeling? (fear, panic, anger)
death: Who was dying in the dream? (you or someone else)
Was the death violent or peaceful?
What did you feel afterward? (relief, fear, emptiness)
fire: Was the fire controlled or spreading?
Were you an observer or intervening?
water: How did the water look? (clear, murky, wavy, calm)
Were you in the water or outside it?
Was the water moving or still?
flying: Were you in control or carried by the wind?
teeth: How were the teeth falling? (by themselves, by impact, crumbling)
Was there anyone watching or noticing?
What did you feel during the falling?
baby: Was the baby related to you? (your child, someone else's)
What was the baby's state? (happy, crying, sick)
Were you holding or watching the baby?
house: Was the house familiar or unknown?
What was the condition of the house? (tidy, messy, damaged)
Which part of the house were you in?
car: Were you driving or a passenger?
Was there control or loss of control in the drive?
Where were you going? (known destination or unknown)
exam: What was the exam about? (school, life test)
What was the outcome? (passed, failed, unknown)
nakedness: Where were you naked? (public, private place)
What did you feel? (shame, comfort, fear)
getting_lost: Where were you lost? (known place, unknown place)
Could you ask for directions or find help?
What was the dominant feeling? (panic, curiosity)
general: What was the dominant emotion in the dream?
Did you recognize anyone or anywhere?
What was your position in the dream? (observer, participant)

chakra.title: Chakra Analysis
chakra.energy_cycle_content: Chakras are not just energy centers, they are doors of consciousness. Each chakra is a bridge between the physical body and the spiritual body. Balancing them is the key not only to health but to inner awakening.

root.description: Muladhara - "Root Support" - symbolized as a 4-petaled red lotus. Located at the base of the spine, this chakra represents survival instincts, security, grounding, and your connection to the material world. It is associated with the Earth element. Ancestral energy is stored here. When balanced, you feel safe and stable.
root.emotional_aspects: Sense of security, stability, basic needs
root.balance_high: You have a strong foundation, you feel secure.
root.balance_low: You need grounding. Spend time in nature.
root.affirmation: I am safe. The universe protects and supports me.

sacral.description: The Sacral chakra is connected to creativity, emotions, sexuality, and the capacity for pleasure.
sacral.balance_high: Your creative energy is flowing, you are at peace with your emotions.
sacral.balance_low: You are having difficulty expressing your emotions.
sacral.balance_mid: Revitalize this energy with creative projects.
healing_suggestions: Dance or move your body freely
sacral.affirmation: My emotions flow freely. I embrace my creativity.

solar_plexus.description: The Solar Plexus chakra is related to personal power, self-confidence, willpower, and sense of identity.
solar_plexus.balance_high: You have a strong sense of self.
solar_plexus.balance_low: You need to rebuild your self-confidence.
solar_plexus.balance_mid: Strengthen by focusing on your goals.
healing_suggestions: Do exercises that strengthen the abdominal area
solar_plexus.affirmation: I am powerful. I have full control over my life.

heart.description: Anahata - "Unstruck Sound" - symbolized as a 12-petaled green lotus. The Heart chakra is the energy of love, compassion, forgiveness, and unconditional acceptance. It is the bridge connecting the physical and spiritual bodies. It is connected to the Air element. When balanced, you experience universal love and compassion for all beings.
heart.balance_high: Your heart is full of love, you are harmonious in your relationships.
heart.balance_low: Show compassion to yourself and others.
heart.balance_mid: Open your heart with forgiveness practices.
healing_suggestions: Spend quality time with loved ones
heart.affirmation: My heart is full of love. I am open to giving and receiving.

throat.description: The Throat chakra is related to communication, self-expression, truth, and creative voice.
throat.balance_low: You are having difficulty making your voice heard.
throat.affirmation: My voice is valuable. I share my truth with love.

third_eye.description: The Third Eye chakra is connected to intuition, inner vision, imagination, and spiritual awareness.
third_eye.balance_high: Your intuition is strong, you are in tune with your inner voice.
third_eye.balance_low: Learn to listen to your intuition.
third_eye.affirmation: I trust my intuition. My inner wisdom guides me.

crown.description: The Crown chakra is related to spiritual connection, enlightenment, universal consciousness, and life purpose.
crown.emotional_aspects: Spiritual connection, search for meaning, unity
crown.balance_high: You have a deep connection with the universe.
crown.balance_low: Strengthen your connection with spiritual practices.
crown.affirmation: I am one with the universe. I am open to divine guidance.

chakra.overall_analysis:
As a {sign}, your energy system is particularly strong in the {strongest} area. This means you have a natural talent in {emotional_aspects} matters.

However, paying more attention to your {weakest} area would be beneficial. You can add the recommended practices for this chakra to your daily routine.

Overall, your chakra system is working harmoniously. You can maintain this balance with regular meditation and awareness practices.
general_tips_list: Meditate for at least 10 minutes every day
Ground yourself by spending time in nature
Write your emotions in a journal

meditation_descriptions.grounding: Imagine roots extending from your feet into the earth. Feel safety and stability.
meditation_descriptions.heart_opening: Imagine a green light in your heart. With each breath, let this light grow.
meditation_descriptions.third_eye_activation: Focus on the point between your eyebrows. Imagine that you can see a purple light.

chakra.daily_description: Today, {chakra} energy is prominent. You can make your day more productive by doing activities aligned with this energy.
chakra.daily_reason: This day of the week corresponds to {chakra} energy.

daily_activities.affirmation_3x: Repeat the affirmation 3 times during the day

rising_sign.title: What is rising sign?
short_answer_bullets: Rising sign is the zodiac sign that was rising on the eastern horizon at the moment of birth.
It determines how the outside world sees you.
It is different from your Sun sign and requires birth time to calculate.
what_it_tells_bullets: Your first impression: What people feel when they first see you.
Your physical appearance: Affects facial features and body structure.
Your defense mechanism: How you behave in new situations.
Your approach to life: How you interact with the world.
difference_from_sun_bullets: Sun sign: Your essence, who you are.
Rising sign: Your mask, how you appear.
Moon sign: Your emotions, what you feel.
how_calculated_bullets: Rising sign changes approximately every 2 hours.
Cannot be calculated if birth time is unknown.
why_important_bullets: It determines all houses in the chart.
It affects which houses the planets fall into.
It positions life areas from career to relationships.

moon_sign_today.title: What sign is the Moon in today?
short_answer_bullets: The Moon changes signs approximately every 2.5 days.
Whatever sign the Moon is in today shapes your emotions.
The Moon sign determines the daily emotional tone.
why_important_bullets: Shapes your needs for nourishment and rest.
daily_life_bullets: When Moon is in a fire sign: Energy rises, impatience may occur.
When Moon is in an earth sign: Good for practical matters.
When Moon is in an air sign: Communication and socializing are highlighted.
When Moon is in a water sign: Emotional depth increases.

aura.title: Aura Analysis
aura.energy_body_description: Aura is the energy field surrounding your physical body. Every thought, emotion, and experience affects the color and intensity of your aura. Your birth date and name determine your primary aura color - this is your spiritual signature. Understanding your aura is the key to managing and protecting your energy.
aura.chakra_balance_info: Chakras are the energy centers in your body. Each one governs different areas of life.

spiritual_advice.red: Ground your energy. Physical activity and nature walks will balance your aura.
spiritual_advice.orange: Express your creativity. Art, dance or music will strengthen your aura.
spiritual_advice.yellow: Keep your mental clarity. Learning and teaching will polish your aura.
spiritual_advice.green: Open your heart. Healing work and helping others will grow your aura.
spiritual_advice.blue: Speak your truth. Honest communication and authentic expression will strengthen your aura.
spiritual_advice.indigo: Trust your intuition. Meditation and dream work will deepen your aura.
spiritual_advice.violet: Strengthen your cosmic connection. Spiritual practices and service will elevate your aura.
spiritual_advice.pink: Spread unconditional love. Compassion and empathy will expand your aura.
spiritual_advice.white: Maintain your purity. Purification rituals and meditation will protect your aura.
spiritual_advice.gold: Remember your divine connection. Prayer and gratitude will polish your aura.

aura.energy_body_secret: The Secret of Your Energy Body
aura.energy_body_secret_content: The concept of aura is based on thousands of years of esoteric tradition. Known as 'ka' in ancient Egypt, this energy body is called 'prana maya kosha' (life energy sheath) in Indian tradition. Modern Kirlian photography has confirmed this ancient wisdom, making visible the bioelectric field around living organisms.
aura.chakra_advice_root: Walk in nature, wear red. Grounding meditations and physical exercises strengthen this chakra.
aura.chakra_advice_sacral: Do creative activities, dance. Eat orange foods and stay close to water element.
aura.chakra_advice_solar: Spend time in sunlight. Do breathing exercises and tell yourself positive affirmations.
aura.chakra_advice_heart: Spend time with loved ones. Keep a gratitude journal and spend time in green spaces.

aura.chakra_advice_crown: Spend time in silence, meditate. Wear white or purple and connect with nature.

daily_guidance.chokhmah: Today is a day of wisdom and insight. Sudden inspirations may come. Be open to new ideas and visions.

daily_meditation.chesed: Imagine golden light radiating from your heart. Feel this light carrying love and compassion to all beings.
daily_meditation.gevurah: Imagine a red flame - burning but purifying. Feel this fire cleansing everything unnecessary.
daily_meditation.tiferet: Imagine being bathed in golden sunlight. Feel this light keeping all opposites in balance.
daily_meditation.netzach: Imagine you are in the middle of a lush green forest. Feel nature's resilience and victory.
daily_meditation.hod: Imagine an orange sphere of light illuminating your mind. Feel your thoughts becoming clearer.
daily_meditation.yesod: Imagine a purple light surrounding your navel area. Feel the door to the dream realm and subconscious opening.
daily_meditation.malkut: Imagine your feet rooting into the earth. Feel the earth's energy giving you strength.

saturn_return.title: Saturn Return
saturn_return.subtitle: The Great Teacher's Cosmic Lessons
saturn_return.kadim_content: Saturn, known as the Lord of Karma in astrology, demands discipline, responsibility, and maturity with each return. Approximately every 29.5 years, this cosmic teacher tests your foundations, destroys structures that don't serve your authentic self, and guides you toward building lasting achievements. The challenges are real, but so are the rewards for those who do the inner work.
saturn_return.in_return: You are in your Saturn Return

info.wisdom_quote: Saturn is the cosmic teacher. During its returns, it confronts us with our limits, responsibilities, and true selves.

active_messages.first: In this transition to adulthood, you are defining your career and life direction. This period may be challenging but will strengthen you.
active_messages.second: Transition to the second half of life. Your true priorities are becoming clearer, combining wisdom with experience.
active_messages.third: Time to review your legacy and life purpose. You are passing your wisdom to future generations.
active_messages.default: You are in an important life transformation.

interpretations.first: The First Saturn Return (ages 27-30) is the gateway to adulthood. During this time, you balance youthful dreams with reality. Important decisions about career, relationships, and life purpose are made. Saturn confronts you with your limits and helps you reveal your true potential.
interpretations.second: The Second Saturn Return (ages 57-60) is the transition to life's second half. During this time, you understand what truly matters. There is a shift from career peak to sharing wisdom. Physical and emotional health come to the fore.
interpretations.third: The Third Saturn Return (ages 87-90) is the time to evaluate your life legacy. Your wisdom and experiences are passed on to future generations. Spiritual maturity and inner peace are the gifts of this period.
